DOC.brief_summary: The study compare effectiveness amitriptyline versus placebo ( inactive medication ) treat chronic laryngitis . At baseline visit , subject assign random amitriptyline placebo take 8 week . Subjects see clinic baseline 8 week . Improvement measure use standardized symptom scale , self-reported subjective improvement percentage .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Must age 18 old able consent 2 . Must structural pathology tumor previously rule use flexible laryngoscopy 3 . Must able speak read English language 4 . Must fail 2 month longer trial proton pump inhibitor treatment gastroesophageal reflux 5 . Women 55 year age may become pregnant must negative pregnancy test agree barrier hormonal method contraception study 1 . Environmental allergy 2 . Smoking within past 5 year 3 . Upper respiratory infection within past 2 month 4 . Use narcotic ( e.g . oxycodone , methadone ) within past week 5 . Any prior history amitryptiline use 6 . Use monoamine oxidase inhibitor ( MAOIs ) amitryptiline within past 4 week ( selegiline , phenelzine , tranylcypromine , isocarboxazid , rasagiline , phenelzine sulfate , selegiline hydrochloride , rasagiline mesylate , tranylcypromine sulfate ) 7 . History urinary retention 8 . Any history major depressive disorder 9 . Any prior history allergy tricyclic antidepressant 10 . Current diagnosis gastroesophageal reflux ( GERD ) 11 .
